website_summaries.verdict: This four-season tent is perfect for adventurous campers. Compact and lightweight enough to easily tote in your pack.
pros: Takes just a couple of minutes to set up
Low-profile design great for windy weather
cons: A small number of users had issues with pole flexibility

customer_reviews.title: What a perfect little tank.
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is a tank. Its way lighter than any onther tent I've purchased and so easy to hike in with. In 2 days we literally tested it in spring and winter. Day 1 it was 60 and sunny and then we woke up day 2 with 5 inches of snow the next morning but were totally comfortable in this tent. Its a bit small for 3 people bit fit my girlfriend, dog, and I really comfortably with warmth and no issues at all. Will update as needed but overall very imoressed with this tent.
customer_reviews.author: elijah

customer_reviews.title: LOVED this tent
customer_reviews.text: LOVED this tent! super light weight and easily packs back up. I used it on a backpacking trip in Colorado above treeline (12,000ft) and it not only survived, but kept me perfectly dry during a 3 hour hail storm. I knocked a star off because the zipper on my fly bent a little bit causing it to either be really hard to zip or to unzip behind itself if you weren't careful. However I contacted the seller and they are sending me a new fly for free. Great customer service
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: Stayed dry and warm! Very light weight!
customer_reviews.text: Tent was easy to set up. Aluminum tent poles are very durable. We fit the two of us and our husky, it was cozy but we stayed warm and dry. The rain fly works amazing, we tested it out on our first hike, it rained very hard, and we stayed dry. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: leila kersten

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected. Extremely light weight. Simple to set up. Included ground cloth is a nice perk. Quality was higher than I expected for this price point. Quality stakes included. First trip with it was used 2 rainy nights backpacking. Tent stayed completely dry. Highly impressed. Recommend to anyone looking for a decent inexpensive tent. I can't comment on longevity yet, clearly it's not expedition quality, but for an occasional backpacker like myself it should hold up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: 80Grady

customer_reviews.title: A nice little budget backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent for my son and I to use cold weather camping. It is comfortably-sized for two people and our gear. The front vestibule keeps our boots dry as well. The included ground mat was a nice feature. The rain fly has a ton of tie-down locations (15 total stakes if you please). It kept the frost off of us through 2 nights in the low-20’sF. Not a perfect score because the zipper seems cheap, the tent without the fly is basically worthless (almost all screen mesh) and it isn’t the easiest to put up. It’s great for the price though, and packs up lite and tight with everything in one bag.
customer_reviews.author: Matt L.

customer_reviews.title: Solid budget tent but more 3 season than 4
customer_reviews.text: This is a 3 season tent not a 4 season it shines for weight, ease of set-up, wind resistance, etc. But is overly ventillated with a rainfly that gaps at the bottom making it drafty. Good for summer bad for winter. The zipper on the rainfly is already getting sticky after 5 uses and has required silicone lube so I don't think it will be long lasting. I am 6' 1" and it was sufficiently long but be careful if you are much taller.
customer_reviews.author: T Howard

customer_reviews.title: Perfromed well
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I just took this tent on a 4 week back country/front country trip and it performed very well. We spent most of our time in the Canadian Rockies late June-early July. It is light and quick to set up. It stood in heavy rain, wind and snow and we stayed dry the entire time. The only thing that wasn't ideal was the exit, since my husband and I are both ~ 6 feet tall, it was rather difficult to get out of the tent. I guess we would likely have that problem with any tent.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Ozmun

customer_reviews.title: Metal poles holding tent broke with my first assembly!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is literally the worst. I never leave bad reviews but being that I am a frequent hiker/camper ... I have to. it was honestly terrible and it does NOT sleep 3 adult females. I repeat it does NOT. I dont know why everyone said it did. The quality was so poor and it literally fell apart on us after a 20 mile hike setting up tent. Thankfully our friend had duck tape to safe the day. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome little tent.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect hiking tent. Set up and take down is very easy. I’d say it’s perfect for one person. When the wife and I used where in it together on a camping trip it was way cramped. It fit both sleeping bags alongside one another but you weren’t moving much. Also make sure the outer liner is pulled away from the tent or you will get condensation from morning dew.
customer_reviews.author: Jose C.

customer_reviews.title: Zippers are cheep & tent is uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The Strap that’s tied to zipper on door pulled off on first use. I would be cautious about using the zippers because they’re cheaply made, I have a Walmart tent that used better material for their zippers. Also, it’s very uncomfortable for two adults. It really needs more head room & two doors, if you’re going to use for two people. I’m returning and buying the north face triarch2 tent my friend was using. It weighs less and has more headroom, but it does cost more money. I guess you get what you pay for:(
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: love.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little tent, it held up well. It ended up raining, as my daughter and niece were camping out in the backyard, and they didnt have any issues with rain coming in, until they opened the door. So, that might be your only problem. Other than that, set up was super duper easy, I did it myself in about 10min. Take down was also easy, it folded right back up for easy storage. Its a little small for two adults, honestly, my 13yr old niece and 7yr old daughter had enough room, but two average adults might find it a bit snug. It's a great tent though, just wish it was a tad bit bigger. Id buy it again though.
customer_reviews.author: lyn

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to put up, stays dry in storms, and packs away quickly. Granted after many uses this isn't the best tent for me (it's my fault for not reading the aspects closely), but if you're over 5'9" you may be a but cramped. I'm 6'1" 150 lbs" and there is no room for me to move around inside the tent. If you're shorter though I would recommend it for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF! NOT WORTH THE MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: This tent was supposed to be extremely waterproof right out of the box!!! Well let's just say, that fact was not true, extremely exaggerated!!! At the expense of my little granddaughter and her buddy! They basically had to swim in their tent! With only a couple of light storms!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi H.

customer_reviews.title: Very drafty.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is advertised as a 4 season tent. However there is way too much screen for air to flow through verse the solid nylon that does not allow air to flow through. So it feels very drafty if the canopy is not perfectly sealed to the ground and that makes for a terrible nights sleep when it is below freezing outside with a slight wind. The outer canopy zipper is hard to reach from the inner tent because it sits so low. It would have been nice to have that zip up to close instead of zipping down. The construction seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Hettinger

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Was a little skeptical on this purchase, but couldn’t be happier. Spent 5 days in the bitterroot mountains with this tent. We had rain almost everyday at some point pea-marble size hail as well as flooding and the tent held up through all of it. My only complaint is the size, but I knew that before I bought it. It’s definitely a tight squeeze with 2 adults (both 6’2” about 190lbs). I would definitely recommend this to someone who is looking for a quality tent on a budget
customer_reviews.author: k0rY3677

customer_reviews.title: great value for lightweight backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: If cost is not an issue for you, then buy the Nemo Hornet. For those with budget constraints, this is an excellent second option. It is almost as lightweight as the Nemo, is of quality construction and materials, and is easy to set up. My first and only use so far was in temperature around 40 degrees under clear skies, so I cannot say for certain how it would perform in rain, wind, or extreme cold. But it is a good design, so I believe it would do well if set up in a good location. I am 5'9", 180 lbs and the 1 man model was plenty roomy enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: craigm

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and great for hiking/camping
customer_reviews.text: I love it! The 2 person is definitely smaller than I expected, but the dimensions provided are accurate.. (fits 2 yoga mats) idk why I thought it would be bigger... It fits myself and my dog perfectly, but 2 people would be a little cozy. I would give it 5 stars, but it came with a very small blemish in the window netting. It looks like that area could rip easier in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is an outstanding 3-season (and possibly 4-season) tent. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Some reviewers have said this tent is difficult to pitch. After an extensive trip with this tent, with set-ups even in high winds, our experience would say that nothing could be further off the mark. The tent is straightforwardly easy to pitch, strong in winds, and dry in rain. We are happy to give this tent 5 stars. We like the tent so much that we are ordering a replacement, on account of a boneheaded mistake with our car carrier that allowed the fly to blow away while were driving. In replacement, we specifically wanted this tent. Later on, we intend to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for us
customer_reviews.text: We took this tent to Smokey Mountains in late Sept. It rained for 2 of the 4 days we backpacked. The tent never leaked and condensation wasn't bad. It was easy to set up and take down and we stayed warm and dry. The zipper on the fly is a little tricky - go very slowly every time. Would have given 5 stars if it hadn't been for the zipper.
customer_reviews.author: Lelemc

customer_reviews.title: Naturehike Cloud-Up 3 Person Lightweight Backpacking Tent
customer_reviews.text: Naturehike Cloud-Up 3 Person Lightweight Backpacking Tent, was easy to set up without any issues. This tent was also easy to take down and repack. I kept the foot-print floor tarp with the tent and folded it up together and was easy to fit back in the bag. works good with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C.

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Took this camping (it's the one on the left in the picture) and was surprised by how sturdy and well made it was for the price. It's also really warm, perfect for colder months as well as hotter months if you leave the rainflap off. It's DEFINITELY waterproof too (it rained a ton during our whole trip and withstood really heavy winds without budging an inch). Makes tent camping fun!
customer_reviews.author: GirlieM

customer_reviews.title: Great value and overall quality
customer_reviews.text: I've now had this tent for nearly two years and taken it all over the mountains of NC and Virginia. It's survived snow, torrential rains, and mountain top winds, keeping me dry at all times, including two inches of heavy rain in the Smokies just last week. I did end up replacing the stakes for sturdier ones, but I've done that with every tent I've had at some point. It's also roomy for it's size, with plenty of room for two sleeping bags and gear in the three man tent.
customer_reviews.author: Haak

customer_reviews.title: Compact, light and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Planning a motorcycle trip to Alaska. I need a tent to be light, compact and free standing. I set this up with out any preparation and did it in 3.53 minutes and easily replaced it in its factory bag. I purchased the two person which works well allowing me room for my sleeping bad and my riding gear to keep it out of the weather at night. I have not yet had it long enough to rate durability. The description of size and weigh is spot on and fits perfectly in the side bag of my motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Strass

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight tent for bike camping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent as a present for my adult son for a camping trip to Newfoundland. His trip isn't till November so I don't have his feedback on how the tent worked out. But it had great reviews and is a four season tent with extras so it seems like a very good buy. Came boxed well and fast delivery. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: CCL.

customer_reviews.title: Great tent! Affordable, well made, easy to put up and take down.
customer_reviews.text: Each time i use this tent i discover something else I love about it. Secret side pockets inside for you to stow items. The sides are pulled up off the ground, so if it rains heavy, your tent won't flood. Tall ceiling so i can sit up and stretch. Good airflow. I still can't believe the price of this tent!
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Great little tent for backpacking/ Just got back from a test night at a campground with my dog, Enough room for my 6'2 frame, gear, and my dog inside the tent. Got a bit windy overnight but this tent blocked most of it and vented enough that there was no condensation when I woke up.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Not for beach
customer_reviews.text: I camped in the woods and on the beach sand. PROS: Light weight Easy to assemble Warm CONS: Flap too much woth wind not possible to sleep. Sand come inside with wind. I camped on the sand and I ate sand the whole night. There was wind about 15 kt and the sand penetrated the mosquito net and lots of sand covered the floor. Sand was coming to my face, eyes, mouth. It was a nightmare. The problem is that the mosquito net start to low at the front and at the back of the tent. The laterals are fine because start higher. I think they should rethink about this.
customer_reviews.author: Rainer Facchin dos Santos

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a 20 mile trip.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I slept in this tent one night. It was tight, but I'm 6' and 240 lbs. Fortunately, she is a normal-sized 11-year-old. The tent was easy to set up and not too heavy to carry on my pack. I'm satisfied and hope to get another chance to use it soon.
customer_reviews.author: Cave Man

customer_reviews.title: Nifty little thing.
customer_reviews.text: This tent came cross country with me and held up against constant light rain with ONE drop inside that I may have tracked in myself. Good ventilation for August heat, I could have napped midday in my tent without boiling. Didn't get too cold at night, holds warmth well. My only cons: Even though this is a 2 person tent and I'm 5'5 and petite, it's gonna be a real squeeze with my also slender partner. My sleep pad and bag butted up against the sides of the tent because they were too long. I wouldn't recommend for someone over 6 ft.
customer_reviews.author: Bre

customer_reviews.title: Right for the price..
customer_reviews.text: Do quite a bit of backpacking, after the dogs destroyed our last tent I wasn't willing to invest in another pricey set up. This one definitely gets the job done. We definitely won't have a problem fitting two adults and two large dogs in it. Set up is a little finnicky, there's only one orientation that works, but not too difficult to get it right. Honestly seems like a solid set up, we had one night in 25degree weather and this did fine. Would never use it for a solo camping trip, but with weight and storage split between two people this works.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: A well made lightweight tent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent as a Christmas gift to myself. To my delight, it came earlier than I thought it would. When I ripped it out of the package and put it up to check it out in my back yard I was thrilled. It was lightweight, but the material was very strong. Also the seams were well sewn. The poles were so easy to put together and seemed strong. Time will tell there. It fits perfectly in my backpack with room to spare for my other things. This product went beyond my expectations. Five stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and durable
customer_reviews.text: when it says 2 people, it means kids, when it says 3, it means clowns, but as a 1 person hiking tent, it IS really nice, as long as its not a rainy summer day *the rain fly is very insulated and holds in heat amazingly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent for climbing
customer_reviews.text: Worked out well for a climb up Mt. Whitney. Held up through some wind. Super easy to assemble, little tough getting back in bag, but that's expected. Worked as a one or two person tent.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Great backpacking tent, excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Love the tent. Spent 10 days in the Boundary Waters in Northern Minnesota. Held up very well to torrential downpours. I have the Two person. Good for one person and some gear honestly. I’m 5’10” 195 lbs. Vestibule isn’t huge, big enough for about 4 pairs of boots. Entry and exit zipper work very well, vestibule zipper sticks some. Setup is very easy and intuitive. Great value for the money. Would recommend this tent to a friend 100 out of 100 times.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon C. Heimericks

customer_reviews.title: Good quality at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Only slept in it once. Bought it for a October hike out west. It was roomy for a one person tent. The directions were poor, but once I figured it out it was an easy setup. I believe I can set it up in under five or six minutes. I left it set up to see how it would stand up to thunderstorms. It went through 2 of them with no issues at all. It seems to be worth the cost. I will know more after my two week trip.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price...
customer_reviews.text: Used the 3 person tent for 7 days in Colorado and Wyoming (Yellowstone). It was pretty easy to setup, lasted through some 40-50 miles wind and a day of rain with no water getting in. For the price, I'm pretty happy with it, the zippers were smooth, the air vents did a good job with very little condensation. Too early to tell if it's durable, if anything changes I'll be updating the review, hope to camp for about a week in Salt Lake in December.
customer_reviews.author: I. Ana

customer_reviews.title: light and compact!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent! I set it up by myself in literally 4 minutes. So easy and love the green color! Two-person is the perfect size if you're like me and tend to move a lot when you sleep. I'm not sure I would love to share the space with another person. Overall a great tent for all types of camping!
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: Quality tent and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Vet lightweight. Perfect for backpacking. We brought it for a short camping trip and it’s very sturdy. Able to sustain windy condition and the frame is very good quality. Very good buy
customer_reviews.author: HJ

customer_reviews.title: Really good quality tent
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality tent! Very lightweight and compact for backpacking. Pretty much the same design as my old big Agnes fly creek ul2. I would recommend this to anybody looking for a good quality lightweight and inexpensive tent.
customer_reviews.author: Jd

customer_reviews.title: Works great for backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this tent about five times so far and have been very happy with it. It's sleeps two full grown adults and a dog pretty nicely. Setup for this tent is super easy and normally takes me only a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P.

customer_reviews.title: You won’t regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is amazing!! Perfect for two people with gear, very easy assembly and it comes with a foot print. This was used on our back packing trips and ways about 5lbs but split n half is only 2.5.
customer_reviews.author: Dvitale

customer_reviews.title: Weight and price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty light for the price. It seems really well made but it has to be tested in the wild yet. So far so good
customer_reviews.author: Manuel W.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Like the single connected poles that were very easy to set up and take down. The set up time takes about two minutes total and can easily be done by one person. Very satisfied with this product and it is very nicely priced vs. the competition.
customer_reviews.author: Doug R

customer_reviews.title: Light weigh and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great 2 person tent for backpacking. Very light, packs up quickly and is small. The poll system could not be easier. It comes with it's own minimal ground cover that attaches securely, but I'm glad a brought a slightly larger one. This is the kind of tent you want when you are on the move and setup in a new camp each night. Next stop, Estes Park Colorado.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: I bought it for my w/e runaways
customer_reviews.text: I did not use it yet but I have purchased it after a long investigation. What made me buy it is that its lightweight and it is been highly recommended by hikers and cyclists. It looks nice and comfy.
customer_reviews.author: MAli

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.text: Okay. So the first weekend i used this tent we had two colliding storms come through right over us so the wind levels were insane. Lightening everywhere and a TON of rain fall. This tent worked so well. Thankyou for making such a fine product.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Worked for Me
customer_reviews.text: As someone that does not camp regularly this is a great tent that is easy to set up and break down. I would recommend it for the casual camper.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy light tent
customer_reviews.text: Great light tent at a reasonable price Easy to set up Worked fine on our 5 day trip and it is plenty of space for one person Could probably fit two slim persons as well
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent once so far. Was quick and easy to assemble. So far no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for backpacking when storms are imminent.
customer_reviews.text: Pole system is innovative and super easy to set up. Perfect for backpacking, light weight, strong super light stakes, nice zippers and protective rainfly area to cover packs at night. Several buddies on the trip commented how they liked my nice tent.
customer_reviews.author: Jamilah

customer_reviews.title: Heavier than advertised
customer_reviews.text: Never used. Tent is a full pound heavier than advertised. This may not be significant to some but this tent is heavier than an REI quarterdome.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent, Convienent size, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This tent was extremely easy to assemble. Great Price. And the Doe that joined me seemed to like it too. lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small but efficient
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality and design of the tent. However, its on the small side and suitable to lay down in, but not much else.
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 2p tent recently. Havent got the chance to use it yet, will keep you updated. It was easy to assemble. Didnt come with instructions, but google search was enough. 2p might not be enough for 2 full grown men. Will have to test it out. Everything else is good!
customer_reviews.author: Shrey Agarwal

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up. Used for 5 day camping trip along the Deschutes in Oregon. Nice and light. The 3man tent is definitely made to fit two. Handled 15mph winds. No rain, so can’t speak to waterproofness. Great alternative to the more expensive backpacking tents.
customer_reviews.author: Meaghan Baker

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, although I had the three man and really only 2 fit comfortably with room for gear.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Very quick and easy to set up and take down. Lightweight and compact. Would buy again (and plan on buying the 4-season as well).
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Decent tent
customer_reviews.text: First time using this tent backpacking in the Adirondack mountains in late October. Low temps around 30 degrees. Lightweight, easy to assemble and disassemble, stayed dry through heavy rain and warm through heavy wind. Plenty of room for myself and gear. Vestibule is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Benson

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tent..
customer_reviews.text: Nice little tent...nice and light for backpacking easy set up. No instructions but pretty straight forward.. Does come with foot print and stakes!! I'm using it now on the campsite..
customer_reviews.author: J. Brower

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, easy set up!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bad boy for a trip in Yosemite. Very quick set up, and everyone complimented it. Can’t wait to test it out in the mountains for snowboarding season!
customer_reviews.author: anthonyyaa

customer_reviews.title: 5 star tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is really good, although the zippers could be bolder
customer_reviews.author: Leonid

customer_reviews.title: Bent pole...buyers beware
customer_reviews.text: Received item with a bent pole. Not sure how to go about requesting a new pole system. Until then I'll give it 1 star for defective product. Went to open up the tent yesterday (the day I got it) at the campsite to disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Coty

customer_reviews.title: Has set up nicely a couple of times
customer_reviews.text: Feels a little cheap. Has set up nicely a couple of times, but I’ve been lucky and had no rain. The slider togs and rope are don’t seem like the most durable materials. Seems worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Christofer Coppinger

customer_reviews.title: Fair product
customer_reviews.text: Took this tent camping at Davis Mountains Park in Texas for 3 days. No real issues but the weather was great. Easy to take down and set up. This tent was designed for smaller people. Keep that in mind when buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It's worked way better than expected super durable and lightweight definitely worth it as a nice starter camping setup
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tent
customer_reviews.text: Tent arrived on time and is exactly what i was expecting. Haven’t had a chance to use it yet, but did set it up in the back yard and it was easy to assemble and seems like a good tent.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Neitzel

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. Great tent! Only takes 5 mins to fully setup and stake down. Got rained on and stayed completely dry. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Cost efficient performance!
customer_reviews.text: Used it in some good and bad weather here in Texas so far and it handles the wind and rain well. No leaking, very little condensation and shrugged off 25mph sustain winds with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wynn

customer_reviews.title: Your perfect backwoods house
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup once you get use to it, very spacious for 2 people. We enjoyed it on our trip at Isle Royale National Park
customer_reviews.author: Gianfranco Velazco Lercari

customer_reviews.title: Quality tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and it fit me and my girlfriend with our dog just right.. would recommend to anyone wanting a tent but not wanting to spend a fortune.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It came cut up
customer_reviews.text: The tent looks great but it came with a long slit in the rainfly and another on the tent stuff sack. Looks like a box cutter / razor blade cut. I'd probably give 5 stars if it came undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: eileen creel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I used this tent on an over night backpacking trip. The temperature dropped down to 20 degrees at night and when I woke up, I had no condensation or ice inside my tent. Great for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle E.

customer_reviews.title: Received dirty used item
customer_reviews.text: We received a used one. There’s bird poop on top. Inside of the tent was sandy. Wtf... The tent was crumbed in the bag...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All around good tent
customer_reviews.text: Great price good build lightweight and quick to pack out pack up
customer_reviews.author: Reviewlord

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far
customer_reviews.text: Just set it up in the house but seems solid
customer_reviews.author: thomas r neeb

customer_reviews.title: Haven’t use it yet...
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t use this tent yet, but my friend have one and I like it, I’ll be back to write more review after I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Roeurb

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: Came as described. Love the tent. Stays dry, sets up lightning quick, and packs up light. Doesn’t get much better!
customer_reviews.author: andrew Balog

customer_reviews.title: Using for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: This came with a footprint which I like. The tent is made well for the price.
customer_reviews.author: TracyFish

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, great value!!
customer_reviews.text: Great Backpacking tent. Light weight, very roomy for 2 people. Easy to setup and very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Babbitt

customer_reviews.title: A good option
customer_reviews.text: The tent has a good cost benefit ratio. No special material but well done.
customer_reviews.author: Mauro

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Great product, cheap, a little hard to put up but dont let it discourage you from buying
customer_reviews.author: Adam m.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and so easy to assemble. Was my cozy home for two days and nights on my first backpacking trip.
customer_reviews.author: SASHA S.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and useful
customer_reviews.text: Took it on a hiking trip in AZ. It worked perfectly and was really easy to set up and carry.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent light weight durable components
customer_reviews.text: High quality tent , components seem very durable performed well in a windstorm in the Big Bend area.
customer_reviews.author: dturner

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great durable tent that is worth its price! nice quality and great price! Worth thing!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: and easy to construct
customer_reviews.text: This tent is just what I wanted. Lightweight, durable, and easy to construct. Worked perfect for my mountain climb.
customer_reviews.author: passionpanties

customer_reviews.title: arrived on time
customer_reviews.text: not had time to use yet. arrived as stated in advert
customer_reviews.author: GLYNN

customer_reviews.title: The tent works just as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: The tent works just as advertised! It's light weight, which made it great for my hiking/backpacking trip, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: kong quan

product_meta.title: Naturehike Cloud-Up 1, 2 and 3 Person Lightweight Backpacking Tent with Footprint - 210T 3 Season Free Standing Dome Camping Hiking Waterproof Backpack Tents
feature_bullets: LIGHTWEIGHT: The Naturehike cloud up tent still maintains the ultralight weight that minimalist backpackers look for. The cloud up ultralight tent only weighs 3.8lbs(1 person)/4.7lbs(2 person)/5.7lbs(3 person) .

WATERPROOF: 210T polyester rain fly & bathtub with PU 3000 coating is better in waterproof and firmer than you expected. Weatherproof material with factory-sealed seams keeps you dry and comfortable in all season&all weather conditions!

EASY TO SET UP: It is an outdoor tent that can be quickly assembled in 5 minutes and can be easily assembled by one person according to the procedures and instructions attached to the inside of the outer bag.

QUALITY THROUGHOUT: The high-quality details include but not limited to smooth and reliable YKK dual zippers, mesh interior pockets, incredibly durable rip-stop fabric materials, full-coverage rainfly and firm lightweight structure, to stand up to your biggest adventures.

BUY WITH CONFIDENCE: We stand behind our products and provide a 30-day money-back guarantee for any reason and limited lifetime warranty for quality-related issues. If your product has a manufacturing defect simply let us know!
